resources.string: Caller ID defaults to not restricted. Next call: not restricted
Caller ID defaults to not restricted. Next call: restricted
Caller ID defaults to restricted. Next call: not restricted
Caller ID defaults to restricted. Next call: restricted
%s is being displayed over other apps
The old PIN that you typed is incorrect.
"The PUK that you typed isn't correct."

"To help improve battery life, battery saver reduces your device’s performance and limits vibration, location services and most background data. Email, messaging and other apps that rely on syncing may not be updated unless you open them.
Battery saver turns off automatically when your device is charging."
This will collect information about your current device state to send as an email message. It will take a little time from starting the bug report until it is ready to be sent. Please be patient.

Use this under most circumstances. It allows you to track progress of the report, enter more details about the problem and take screenshots. It might omit some less-used sections that take a long time to report.
Can capture gestures performed on the devices fingerprint sensor.
Can tap, swipe, pinch and perform other gestures.
"Inspect the content of a window that you're interacting with."

To help reduce data usage, Data Saver prevents some apps from sending or receiving data in the background. An app that you’re currently using can access data, but may do so less frequently. This may mean, for example, that images aren’t displayed until you tap them.
"You'll lose any changes and the demo will start again in %1$s seconds…"
Tip: double-tap to zoom in and out.

"The admin app can't be used. Your device will now be erased.
If you have questions, contact your organisation's admin."
The following one or more applications request permission to access your account, now and in the future.
Enter a PIN that is 4 to 8 numbers.
Enter a PUK code that is 8 numbers or more.
Enter PUK code and new PIN

"You have drawn your unlock pattern incorrectly %1$d times. After %2$d more unsuccessful attempts, you will be asked to unlock your phone using your Google sign-in.
Please try again in %3$d seconds."
You have attempted to unlock the phone unsuccessfully %d times. The phone will now be reset to factory defaults.
"Forgotten your username or password? Visit" google.com/accounts/recovery.
Not enough storage for the system. Make sure that you have 250 MB of free space and restart.
"The PINs that you typed don't match."
Cannot change call forwarding settings from your phone while you are roaming.
Operation is restricted to fixed dialling numbers only.
Your SIM card is PUK-locked. Enter the PUK code to unlock it.
Enter PUK2 to unblock SIM card.
Your organisation manages this device and may monitor network traffic. Tap for details.
Allows an application to read and write to the CLOGO block.

This app can get your location based on network sources such as phone masts and Wi-Fi networks. These location services must be turned on and available on your phone for the app to be able to use them.

This app can get your location based on GPS or network location sources such as phone masts and Wi-Fi networks. These location services must be turned on and available on your phone for the app to be able to use them. This may increase battery consumption.
Allows the app to view information about Wi-Fi networking, such as whether Wi-Fi is enabled and the name of connected Wi-Fi devices.
Allows app to have gid mot_tcmd to read/write the Hidden Menu files /persist/public/hiddenmenu
Allows the app to view the configuration of the Bluetooth on the phone and to make and accept connections with paired devices.
Allows the app to configure the local Bluetooth phone and to discover and pair with remote devices.
Allows the app to clear the cache directory if this directory space is lower than some threshold

Allows the app to create network sockets and use customised network protocols. The browser and other applications provide the means to send data to the Internet, so this permission is not required to send data to the Internet.

Allows the app to disable the keylock and any associated password security. For example, the phone disables the keylock when receiving an incoming phone call, then re-enables the keylock when the call has finished.
Allows the app to get the list of accounts known by the phone. This may include any accounts created by applications that you have installed.
Allows the app to retrieve its code, data and cache sizes
Allows an application to add Home screen shortcuts without user intervention.
Allows the app to lock the phone, requiring the user to enter their unlock PIN, password or pattern in order to resume using the phone.
Allows the app to communicate with Near Field Communication (NFC) tags, cards and readers.
Allows the app to make parts of itself persistent in memory. This can limit the memory available to other apps, slowing down the phone.
Allows the app to see the number being dialled during an outgoing call with the option to redirect the call to a different number or abort the call altogether.

Allows the app to read mobile broadcast messages received by your device. Cell broadcast alerts are delivered in some locations to warn you of emergency situations. Malicious apps may interfere with the performance or operation of your device when an emergency mobile broadcast is received.

"Allows the app to read data about your contacts stored on your phone, including the frequency with which you've called, emailed or communicated in other ways with specific individuals. This permission allows apps to save your contact data, and malicious apps may share contact data without your knowledge."
Allows the app to start itself as soon as the system has finished booting. This can make it take longer to start the phone and allow the app to slow down the overall phone by always running.
Allows the app to receive and process MMS messages. This means that the app could monitor or delete messages sent to your device without showing them to you.
Allows the app to receive and process SMS messages. This means that the app could monitor or delete messages sent to your device without showing them to you.
Allows an app to ask for permission to ignore battery optimisations for that app.
Allows single-hand service to set global transform.
Allows the application to remove Home screen shortcuts without user intervention.
Allows management of dual SIM related settings
Allows the app to control vibration.
This app can add, remove or change calendar events on your phone. This app can send messages that may appear to come from calendar owners or change events without notifying their owners.

"Allows the app to modify the data about your contacts stored on your phone, including the frequency with which you've called, emailed or communicated in other ways with specific contacts. This permission allows apps to delete contact data."
"Allows the app to modify the Browser's geo-location permissions. Malicious apps may use this to allow sending location information to arbitrary websites."

"Allows the app to modify the Browser's history or bookmarks stored on your phone. This may allow the app to delete or modify Browser data. Note: this permission may not be enforced by third-party browsers or other applications with web browsing capabilities."
Allows an app to modify the sync settings for an account. For example, this can be used to enable syncing of the People app with an account.
access photos, media and files on your device
Read and write to CLOGO block
Should only be used by Motorola applications to access Hidden Menu files under /persist/public/hiddenmenu
access body sensors (such as heart rate monitors)
read your web bookmarks and history
Should only be used by Motorola applications that have tcmd permission
"add or modify calendar events and send emails to guests without owners' knowledge"
Change how frequently the screen lock password, PIN or pattern must be changed.
"Monitor the number of incorrect attempts to enter a password when unlocking the screen and lock the phone or erase all the phone's data if too many incorrect attempts are made."
Do you want to reboot into safe mode? This will disable all third-party applications that you have installed. They will be restored when you reboot again.

"An application you've just installed is requesting elevated access to your device. Tap below to review whether to grant access
%s"
"International roaming. Sending message may incur charges."

"A SIM card is required to connect to Verizon Wi-Fi Access. You may not have inserted your sim card yet or it may be inserted incorrectly.
Please turn off your phone and make sure your SIM card is properly inserted, then turn your phone back on and try connecting again "

"A SIM card is required to connect to %1$s. You may not have inserted your SIM card yet or it may be inserted incorrectly.
Please turn off your phone and make sure your SIM card is properly inserted, then turn your phone back on and try connecting again "
Wi-Fi Direct connection is active. Do you want to disconnect and connect to another P2P device?
This will turn on your work profile, including apps, background sync and related features
Until you turn off Do not disturb
Until you turn off Do not disturb
Turning ON Wi-Fi will turn OFF Bluetooth Tethering.
Turning ON Wi-Fi will turn OFF USB Tethering.
